channel.title: [718] Removing Dev Console Command

item.title: [718] Removing Dev Console Command
item.dc:creator: @Camballer Camballer
item.description:
@Camballer wrote:

So, the developer console is a pain in the ass, especially for someone who has used 317 revision their entire life. I’ll do whatever it takes to remove it. I’ve been looking at the method and can’t perfect it in a way that it works.

public static boolean processCommand(Player player, String command, boolean console, boolean clientCommand) { if (command.length() == 0) // if they used ::(nothing) theres no command return false; String[] cmd = command.toLowerCase().split(" "); if (cmd.length == 0) return false; if (player.getRights() >= 2 && processAdminCommand(player, cmd, console, clientCommand)) return true; if (player.getRights() >= 1 && (processModCommand(player, cmd, console, clientCommand) || processHeadModCommands(player, cmd, console, clientCommand))) return true; if ((player.isSupporter() || player.getRights() >= 1) && processSupportCommands(player, cmd, console, clientCommand)) return true; if (Settings.ECONOMY) { player.getPackets().sendGameMessage("You can't use any commands in economy mode!"); return true; } return processNormalCommand(player, cmd, console, clientCommand); } There should be a way to change this around to where all player rights can use commands starting with :: rather than the annoying dev console. Has anyone gone upon doing this? Let me know.

Read full topic
